intro: Thysanocarpus runcinatus, commonly known as the slender thysanocarp, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of the Malvaceae family. Thysanocarpus runcinatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
